body:
Summary

### Expected Result

A working jdk

### Actual Result

`/[...]/blueos_3_ppc64le_ib/[...]/bin/javac: cannot execute binary file`

```
$ file /[...]/blueos_3_ppc64le_ib/[...]/bin/javac
/[...]/bin/javac: ELF 64-bit LSB executable, x86-64, version 1 (SYSV), dynamically linked (use
s shared libs), for GNU/Linux 2.6.9, BuildID[sha1]=fa472824c41b020e4e35331a17ee214b1fdb3b51, not stripped
```

### Steps to reproduce the issue

`spack install jdk`

### Information on your system

ppc64le

---

I'm going to try to add an openjdk package to spack some time next week.

Is there some way to make versions depend on the system architecture? It seems like there could be other binaries spack manages, this could affect them too.
title: Spack installs x86 jdk on non-x86 systems
